definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: But I want not to have the bright individuality picture to plant am very difficult to have the development.
sentences.chinese: 但是我想没有鲜明个性的画种是很难有所发展的吧。

definition: lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own

not follow the beaten track/have an original style
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
